intro: Aerides falcata var. houlletiana, commonly known as the Houllet's flying lady, is a rare orchid species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its pendulous, falcate (sickle-shaped) inflorescence and showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. This variety is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its unique appearance and relatively compact growth habit.
